description: The app is really well designed. It's data source even has my city unlike the weather app from the gnome project!
Very good weather app with dyanmic backgrounds (been waiting quite a while for a weather app with that), fits in nicely with other Libadwaita applications & Gnome in general
summary: A clean & simple weather app for Gnome

description: Pretty to look at, has most basic info needed at a glance (even 2 day forecast). It could use improvement on location selection: allow latitude/longitude input, zip code, or [City, State/Province, Country]. Also a radar or link to radar would be useful, since you can input an openweathermap.org key, use that maybe?
It insists on using C and km, although it offers the option to switch to the US system. However, it never does switch. Nice job of testing before publishing!
summary: Won't allow me to switch to US measurements

description: Not showing weather data for my city
summary: not working and not showing weather data for my city

description: The best weather app for a Linux distro. To Switch to Fahrenheit, you will have to click on the entire area not just the dot selection box, otherwise it won't work. Pls fix that.

The Montreal weather is 8c, now, and 6C by 23:00 hrs, (11pm).
The table shows an increasing temperature to 28C by morning, however, Clicking on the Tomorrow tab shows 6C at morning and increasing to 8C during the day.

The weather beyond now, is not showing correctly. The preview view was the Default Indian City view. I am in Canada, half a day difference.

I had an issue with making this change. Ultimately I uninstalled and reinstalled the app and it worked fine. The app even picked up my location on reinstall. 
Images depicting the weather seem to be missing but it gived the data I was interested in seeing.
So much better than GNOME Weather, I'd pay for it.

When it's working it is a lovely app. The visual indicators are clear and easy to understand at a glance, the provided information is exactly enough what a weather app needs, and the settings are simple to modify.

The bad is when you go to add a different city, then remove the existing location (to Dehli, India), the app will refuse to show anything, it's just a blank slate. If you try to open settings nothing happens. 

Uninstalling and reinstalling the app does nothing. Fixing these issues would give this app a 4+ star review.
summary: Won't show anything, Preferences panel won't launch

description: Very Limited on Icons, You have to use the Default icons or it just looks terrible. Not recommended.
summary: Icons for weather are not showing

description: Seems like a good app, but when I set my location to Fahrenheit it always reverts back to Celsius.
summary: Good app but stuck in Celsius

description: At first glance is ok. I can select my city (take that Gnome Weather).
It is a good app but needs a bit more updates like changing location
It shows much more info than the default app, but everything is still easy to find. Great job on the layout.
Stays in F for me despite another review saying it won't. Glad I tried it anyways!
I can't find any city in California, and we are the most populated state in the US. I guess you don't cover weather for the USA?
summary: Can't Find Any City In My State

description: Looks nice but what a worthless app lol
Die Reihenfolge der Uhrzeiten ist Fehlerhaft: 5:00 PM; 8:00 PM; 11:00 PM; 2:00 AM; 5:00 AM; 8:00 AM; 11:00 AM; 2:00 PM
Excelent and beautiful weather app
Es de las pocas aplicaciones del clima que reconocen mi ciudad.
Класссссссссссссссссссссссс
Замурчательное приложение 🤩️
summary: Отзыв от А ну ка давай ка

description: Ubuntu 22.04.3 LTS работает крайне не стабильно. Приложение запускается долго, иногда и вовсе не открывается. При смене города виснет вся система, приходится перезагружать ПК.
